name: Days Inn Pittsburgh Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read the reviews and I found two of them to be absolutely entertaining. I must say I had a blast reading them and picturing every word in my mind...it was great. Most of the reviews are obviously old since I believe that the hotel it is a very good choice for any type of traveler. Price wise and service wise it is an amazing choice. I spent 3 nights at the hotel and everything went better than I had expected. I was picked up from the airport 10 minutes after I called for a shuttle and was allowed to check in before noon since my flight arrived at 10:30 AM. The rooms have everything, beds are very comfortable, room was clean and the temperature was perfect. I was glad to see a fridge and a microwave since I had to be there for 4 days. I took the shuttle to the Mall, restaurants near by and the movie theater. The staff was very polite and they made sure I enjoyed my stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel and the Staff is doing an amazing job going the extra mile.
reviews.title: I guess things have changed

reviews.text: We came into Pittsburgh needing a place to stay. This place was great and not only was it near the airport, but also very close to the city. The breakfast is fulfilling, but nothing to brag about. The rooms was clean and comfortable. The television has about 35 channels, enough to stay informed about current news and sports events. While talking to the owner, he told me they have updated recently, meaning the later posts are incorrect and outdated. The hotel has went through some major renovation to meet the customers demands and this is clearly seen. The staff was very polite and friendly. I would highly highly recommend staying here because it will meet your budget and is a great Days Inn venue.
reviews.title: Great Price and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in Days Inn for 1 night only, as we had an early morning flight. The hotel was about 10 minutes from Airport but they provide a free shuttle bus to airport which is great! the hotel room was fine, well equipped, i could hear next doors TV which was a bit annoying! overall it was fine for what we needed we were at the hotel late at night and left early morning. there was a buffet breakfast, which i didnt really get to use but I got an apple and coffee, crossaint which set me up for the day
reviews.title: good for early morning flight

reviews.text: There is a reason this was the only hotel available over New Year's on short notice. IT WAS TERRIBLE. We got there right around 3 to check in and were instructed to wait for the changing of shifts so the paperwork could be properly accounted for. This was fine. The next thing we were told was that check out was at 11. We had not even checked in yet and we would be there for 4 days. Then we found out one of the two rooms we reserved were not cleaned yet. Still I was Ok. It was right at 3 and maybe they thought we were arriving later.
reviews.title: Be Afraid, Be very afraid

likes.liked: — close proximity to the activities we had planned in Pittsburgh
likes.disliked: — staff, rooms, breakfast buffet, lack of cleanliness

reviews.text: When we all went to wait in my daughter's room, the clean room, we found a present in the fridge, an old rotisserie chicken. And on top of the fridge, some coffee growing mold to finish off the meal. I pointed this out to housekeeping that was across the hall. I finally unplugged the coffee maker and took it out of the room to them.
reviews.title: Worst hotel room I've ever stayed in, damp, mold, in state of disrepair...

likes.liked: — there was hot water... not much else
likes.disliked: — it was the biggest dump I

reviews.text: We checked in and were charged an additional $35 to leave our car for 10 days.
reviews.title: What an unhealthy mess never ever again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we entered the room, it smelled musty, the carpet was damp, the lights above the bed were the only ones working, no lights in the bathroom.
reviews.title: nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To top it off when I looked it the ice bucket the mold in the bottom of the bucket was so bad the plastic bag could not be removed from the bucket. When I took the bucket to the front desk, he wanted to know what was wrong with it. I had to show him twice before he realized the mold was not normal. It took an hour and a half before they brought me another one.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I complained the next morning the man at the front desk said never even acknowledged I was standing in front of him. He handed me my receipt for the parking and turned away.
reviews.title: DO NOT Stay Here

reviews.text: Returning from my trip I waited 40 minutes for the shuttle; when they told us it would be 20 minutes. The driver did not speak, no hi, no questions, not even checking to see if he had the correct passengers. He just threw the bags in and was ready to go. I had $5 for a tip to give him. I kept the tip
reviews.title: What a dirty hotel---stayed in a cleaner hotel in Cambodia.

reviews.text: We have used this hotel for 3 years now to park, stay for the night and fly out early in the morning. The lobby is nice and the hallway carpet dirty as others have said but the room has always been clean. This hotel gets a lot of use. The breakfast is typical of an average hotel. The morning drivers to the airport have always been friendly. Pick up at the airport has always been less than a 30 minute wait. The hotel serves our needs.
reviews.title: Godd for park and fly.

reviews.text: I stayed there and did not feel comfortable at all. The hotel is outdated (new bedspreads, carpet, and paint would do wonders for this place). Plus, hair was everywhere...on the linens, on the remote, on the floor, on the towels and it creeped me out. The room was clean for the most part, but I just had this feeling were I didn't want to touch anything. I travel with Lysol, so that helped. The staff was nice and the location is great, but I wouldn't stay there again.
reviews.title: Not a comfortable stay...

reviews.text: The lobby area of the hotel was clean, but the rooms were not. We had a group with 8 rooms. One room out of the 8 was acceptable. One room...the smell of urine in the bathroom was almost unbearable. Another room....there was long, black hair caked to the side of the shower. Another room...had urine dried all over the toilet lid and around toilet. These are just a few examples of the rooms you are getting. I will (nor anyone else in our group) will EVER stay at this hotel. We thought it would be ok, especially with the price of the rooms...No!!!!
reviews.title: please be aware...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Room was inhabitable, there was Spider Web all over the Room, the Room was Damp and had a terrible odor, Carpet soiled with Roach and Mouse droppings, the Bathroom Door was missing and there was no phone or Intercom in the room
reviews.title: Roach Motel

reviews.text: First room was filthy
reviews.title: Filthy

reviews.text: Oh my god do not stay here! The staff here are very rude not hi hello how ya doing nothing! They don't even acknoledge that your there! I tried to get are room clean at about 1215pm and they said that the house keepers already had left and if I needed anything to come get it so I went down to the front and no one was even there. There's no bath tubs just showers which ours was broke and leaker water everywhere we asked the lady working what they had for breakfast and she said I dunno do not stay here service and everything else is terrible!
reviews.title: Do not stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night before our flight out of Pittsburgh Int'l Airport. We paid just a bit over $80 for the night along with 8 nights of parking included in that price. The hotel is in a good location because it's near shopping and some nice restaurants, so we didn't have to travel far to go to dinner and pick up a couple of things at the local SuperK once we've checked in. The hotel is neat and clean, and the price even included a nice breakfast - even included make your own waffles - and the morning paper, along with transfers to and from the airport. We would have liked to have a larger bed - we only got a queen size for this price, but for one night it was not a problem. Upon our return, we called Days Inn so that they could send the shuttle to pick us up - that took about 20 minutes. All in all, a decent place to stay and park - we'd do it again
reviews.title: Good value - clean

reviews.text: Stayed here twice. Rooms were clean although showing their age a bit, sheets clean, bathroom clean. Towels thin but adequate. Hallways a bit shabby but really ok except that there was a strong smell of carpet cleaner. I called several hotels before this one, all more expensive than this, because I needed to leave a bag overnight between stays and this was the only one that would keep it for me; even though it was apparently an unusual request, they worked it out. Microwave, fridge, coffeepot, hairdryer, iron, clock radio, AC in room. Location was good for me as I had multiple flights out of PIT. For days in town, I took the shuttle to the airport and then took the Airport Flyer bus downtown for $2.75. Once I waited a long time, but they were very prompt on the other occasions. The continental breakfast is better-than-average, includes bagels with cream cheese, instant oatmeal, fresh waffles. Pool clean and very warm. Much better than I expected, and an excellent value.
reviews.title: Helpful staff, good value

reviews.text: I stayed tonight. I booked for 2 queen bed, but I got single queen bed room. I slept on the floor as I have kids. The service representtaive was so rude when I asked for 2 double bed room.
reviews.title: Very BAD Hotel to Stay

reviews.text: I have good impression on Days Inn hotel, but with today's stay, I need to rethink of my opinion.
reviews.title: Definitely needs upgraded!!!

aka: Days Inn Pittsburgh International Airport Hotel
description: Explore Pittsburgh from our Days Inn Pittsburgh Airport hotel near Robinson Town Centre in the West Hills. Just seven miles from Pittsburgh International Airport, our Coraopolis hotel offers great amenities like free Wi-Fi Internet access, airport shuttle and park and fly packages, as well as a heated indoor pool and fitness center.
